org.shared.array

Interface Array<T extends Array<T,E>,E>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the parameterization lower bounded by Array itself.
    E - the component type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Matrix<T,E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractArray, AbstractComplexArray, AbstractRealArray, ComplexArray, DerivativeOfGaussian, Gabor, GaborCircular, IntegerArray, IntegerSparseArray, IntegralHistogram, IntegralImage, LaplacianOfGaussian, Mean, ObjectArray, ObjectSparseArray, ProtoArray, ProtoSparseArray, RealArray, RealSparseArray

    public interface Array<T extends Array<T,E>,E>
extends Cloneable
    Defines functionality that can be expected from all multidimensional arrays.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Array.IndexingOrder
      An enumeration of internal storage orders for Arrays.

      • map

        T map(T dst,
    int... bounds)
        Maps this array into a destination array.
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination array.
        bounds - the mapping bounds as an array of three-tuples. Given the ith tuple, the first component denotes the source start, the second component denotes the destination start, and the third component denotes the mapping size. Is very much the multidimensional analogy to System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int).
        Returns:
        the destination array.

      • splice

        T splice(T dst,
       int... slices)
        A primitive slicing operation.
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination array.
        slices - the slicing specifications as an array of three-tuples. Given the ith tuple, the first component denotes the source index, the second component denotes the destination index, and the third component denotes the dimension of interest. The sliced portion is the Cartesian product subarray delineated by these specifications.
        Returns:
        the destination array.

      • slice

        T slice(int[][] srcSlices,
      T dst,
      int[][] dstSlices)
        Slices this array into a destination array.
        Parameters:
        srcSlices - the source slicing indices along each dimension.
        dst - the destination array.
        dstSlices - the destination slicing indices along each dimension.
        Returns:
        the destination array.

      • slice

        T slice(T dst,
      int[]... dstSlices)
        Slices this entire array into a destination array.
        Parameters:
        dst - the destination array.
        dstSlices - the destination slicing indices along each dimension.
        Returns:
        the destination array.

      • slice

        T slice(E value,
      int[]... srcSlices)
        Slices a value into this array.
        Parameters:
        value - the value.
        srcSlices - the source slicing indices along each dimension.
        Returns:
        this array.

      • slice

        T slice(int[]... srcSlices)
        Gets a subarray specified by the given slicing indices.
        Parameters:
        srcSlices - the slicing indices.
        Returns:
        the subarray.

      • subarray

        T subarray(int... bounds)
        Gets a subarray delimited by the given bounds.
        Parameters:
        bounds - the subarray bounds as an array of two-tuples. Given the ith tuple, the first component is the (inclusive) lower range and the second component is the (exclusive) upper range.
        Returns:
        the subarray.

      • tile

        T tile(int... repetitions)
        Tiles this array according to the given number repetitions along each dimension.
        Parameters:
        repetitions - the number times to repeat along each dimension.
        Returns:
        the tiled result.

      • transpose

        T transpose(int... permutation)
        Transposes (permutes) the dimensions of this array.
        Parameters:
        permutation - the dimension permutation.
        Returns:
        the transposed result.

        T shift(int... shifts)
        Circularly shifts this array.
        Parameters:
        shifts - the shift amounts.
        Returns:
        the shifted array.

        Reshapes this array.

        Returns:
        the reshaped array.

        T reverse(int... opDims)
        Reverses along the given dimensions.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the reversed array.
